message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Varicella-zoster virus, which causes shingles, has an envelope composed of nuclear membrane molecules. Yellow fever and Ebola are both single-stranded RNA viruses while Condylomata acuminata is caused by human papillomavirus, which is a double-stranded DNA virus.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only the varicella-zoster virus, which causes shingles, has an envelope composed of nuclear membrane molecules. Yellow fever and Ebola are both caused by RNA viruses, while Condylomata acuminata is caused by a DNA virus, and none of them have an envelope composed of nuclear membrane molecules.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only shingles, caused by the varicella-zoster virus, has an envelope composed of nuclear membrane molecules. Yellow fever is caused by a flavivirus, Ebola by Ebolavirus, and condylomata acuminata by human papillomavirus, none of which have an envelope composed of nuclear membrane molecules.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Shingles (caused by the Varicella-zoster virus) has an envelope composed of nuclear membrane molecules. Yellow fever is caused by a flavivirus, Ebola is caused by an ebolavirus, and Condylomata acuminata (genital warts) is caused by human papillomavirus, none of which have an envelope composed of nuclear membrane molecules.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Shingles is caused by the Varicella-zoster virus, which has an envelope composed of nuclear membrane molecules. Yellow fever is caused by a flavivirus, Ebola is a filovirus, and Condylomata acuminata is caused by human papillomavirus, all of which do not have nuclear membrane envelopes.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only herpes zoster virus (which causes shingles) has an envelope composed of nuclear membrane molecules. Yellow fever virus has a smooth envelope, Ebola virus has a filamentous envelope, and human papillomavirus (which causes condylomata acuminata) is non-enveloped.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The virus that has an envelope composed of nuclear membrane molecules is most likely herpesvirus, which can cause shingles (herpes zoster). Yellow fever is caused by a flavivirus, Ebola by a filovirus, and Condylomata acuminata by human papillomavirus, none of which are known to have an envelope composed of nuclear membrane molecules.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Shingles, caused by the varicella-zoster virus, has an envelope composed of nuclear membrane molecules. Yellow fever, Ebola, and condylomata acuminata do not have such an envelope.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Only the varicella-zoster virus, which causes shingles, has an envelope composed of nuclear membrane molecules. Yellow fever, Ebola, and Condylomata acuminata do not have this characteristic.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Shingles (caused by the varicella-zoster virus) is the only option listed that has an envelope composed of nuclear membrane molecules. Yellow fever has an envelope of host-cell derived lipid membranes, Ebola has a lipid envelope, and Condylomata acuminata is caused by the human papillomavirus, which is non-enveloped.
